original_title: Sri Lanka’s mid day shares down on lack of direction
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s shares edged down in mid day trade on Friday, due to price declines in index heavy shares, an analyst said.
“The market is down on the lack of direction in domestic debt restructuring and debt optimization,” an analyst said.
The main All Share Price Index was down 0.34 percent or 29.23 points to 8,683.49, while the most liquid index S&P SL20 was down 0.38 percent or 9.52 points to 2,480.30.
Top losers during mid day trade were John Keells, Cargills and Citizens Development Bank. (Colombo/May26/2023)
